Which of the following could be the graph of <math alttext="f" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>f</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> ?

choices.label: The figure presents a graph in the x y coordinates plane, with the origin labeled O. The number 3 is indicated on the x axis. The graph consists of two line segments, and includes one open circle. The first line segment begins to the left of the y axis, and above the x axis. It moves downward and to the right, and crosses the y axis above the origin. It continues downward until it reaches an open circle at a point where x equals 3, just above the x axis. The second line segment begins at the open circle, and moves upward and to the right until it ends to the right of the y axis, and above the x axis.

The figure presents a graph in the x y coordinate plane, with the origin labeled O. The number 3 is indicated on the x axis. The graph consists of two curves. The first curve, which opens upward, begins to the left of the y axis, and above the x axis. It moves downward and to the right, levels off and reaches a minimum to the left of the y axis, just above the x axis. It then moves upward and to the right, and crosses the y axis above the origin. It continues upward until it ends at a point where x equals 3, high above the x axis. The second curve, which opens downward, begins at the point where x equals 3, and moves downward and to the right until it ends to the right of the y axis, and above the x axis.
